mentionedBy.name: Atlassian Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Source code hosting platform owned by Microsoft

mentionedBy.name: Atlassian Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Microsoft-owned source code platform, dominant in developer community

mentionedBy.name: Atlassian Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Widely used platform for hosting and collaborating on code repositories with seamless integration with developer tools and vast community. Integrated capabilities for access control, bug logging, feature requests, project management, and wikis. Excellent for open-source projects

mentionedBy.name: GitLab Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Dominant code hosting platform, particularly for open source

mentionedBy.name: GitLab Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Primary competitor, owned by Microsoft since 2018, dominant in open source

mentionedBy.name: GitLab Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Focuses on collaboration and community with vast Marketplace of third-party integrations, GitHub Actions for automation, complete cloud-hosted developer platform

mentionedBy.name: GitLab Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Primary competitor owned by Microsoft, leading code hosting and collaboration platform

mentionedBy.name: JFrog Ltd.
mentionedBy.notes: While primarily a source code repository, GitHub was beginning to be used for storing some release artifacts and binaries, though not a dedicated artifact repository solution.

mentionedBy.name: JFrog Ltd.
mentionedBy.notes: Major platform competitor with GitHub Packages, Actions (CI/CD), and comprehensive DevOps capabilities

mentionedBy.name: JFrog Ltd.
mentionedBy.notes: Competes with JFrog across DevOps platforms and artifact management. GitHub Packages provides native package publishing and consumption within repositories, integrated with GitHub Actions for CI/CD workflows.

2015.note: Source code hosting and collaboration platform
Dominant code hosting platform, particularly for open source
While primarily a source code repository, GitHub was beginning to be used for storing some release artifacts and binaries, though not a dedicated artifact repository solution.

2020.note: Source code hosting platform owned by Microsoft
Primary competitor, owned by Microsoft since 2018, dominant in open source

2024.note: Microsoft-owned source code platform, dominant in developer community
Focuses on collaboration and community with vast Marketplace of third-party integrations, GitHub Actions for automation, complete cloud-hosted developer platform
Major platform competitor with GitHub Packages, Actions (CI/CD), and comprehensive DevOps capabilities

2025.note: Widely used platform for hosting and collaborating on code repositories with seamless integration with developer tools and vast community. Integrated capabilities for access control, bug logging, feature requests, project management, and wikis. Excellent for open-source projects
Primary competitor owned by Microsoft, leading code hosting and collaboration platform
